message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.CY

This paper discusses the privacy concerns related to location-based services (LBS) in mobile devices, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also proposes an information-theoretic approach to achieve perfect location privacy, which involves modeling users' movements using Markov chains and changing their pseudonyms before a certain number of observations are made by the adversary. This involves concepts from data structures (cs.DS), information theory (cs.IT), and complex systems (cs.SI). Additionally, the paper discusses the implications of location privacy in wireless networks, which could fall under the category of cyber-physical systems (cs.CY).
